DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study well internet-delivered positive affect ( PA ) intervention work manage emotion young adult cancer survivor . An internet-delivered PA intervention may teach young cancer survivor healthy cop skill help doctor learn effect mood may health well-being young adult cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Internet-Delivered Positive Affect Program Managing Emotion Young Adult Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To adapt individualized positive affect intervention develop newly diagnose HIV patient use young adult cancer survivor . II . To pilot test positive affect intervention young adult cancer survivor determine feasibility acceptability . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To describe health relate quality life , psychological well-being , daily emotion report , health behavior young adult cancer survivor . OUTLINE : Patients complete initial online questionnaire last 25-30 minute report daily emotion via text message week 1-2 week 9-10 . Patients complete internet-delivered PA program week 3-8 . Each week consist didactic material 20-30 minute daily online exercise . At end day PA program , patient provide end day recall report via text message . Patients also receive booster text message email . After completion study , patient follow 1 12 week .
DOC.criteria: Able read understand English Past history cancer diagnosis ( exclude basal cell skin carcinoma ) 18 39 year age diagnosis Within 05 year postactive treatment Wireless internet connection home computer connect internet Have cell phone text message capability Evidence cancer recurrence History multiple primary cancer Currently receive palliative hospice care Significant psychiatric history
